main_definition: Ranks refer to the levels or positions within a hierarchical system, often used in military or organizational contexts, as well as describing relative positioning among items based on certain criteria.

meanings_and_examples.example: In the army, a sergeant holds a higher rank than an enlisted soldier.
A company's CEO has more authority and responsibility compared to its middle managers.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relative positioning of items based on specific criteria
meanings_and_examples.example: When organizing a library, books are ranked by subject matter and alphabetical order within each category.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Levels or grades in school or education system
meanings_and_examples.example: High school students often have to maintain certain grade ranks for admission into competitive colleges.
